intro: Pinus ayacahuite subsp. loudoniana, commonly known as the Mexican white pine, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Pinaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upward-curving needles and relatively small, oval cones. The tree typically grows in mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and a temperate climate. It is valued for its timber and has been used in traditional medicine. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered vulnerable in some areas.
